No bear was observed, but presumably a bear almost opened a Bear Vault 500 and destroyed some cups. It opened one of the tabs on the Bear Vault but did not gain entry.
The visitors heard a noise, turned on a flashlight and pointed it outside their tent and the bear ran off. The bear bit and damaged a guitar case.

BlameFactorDesc: Improper storage of a bear attractant
IncidentDescription: Visitors noticed bike seat ripped up in the morning. Saw a bear in the night. Discovered chapstick in the saddle bag that was beneath the bike seat. No food obtained.

The visitors think that the top latch wasn’t fully engaged. We came by the next day to talk to them and the locker seemed to be working fine with both latches working and not broken or with failing springs. The bear obtained a bag of pasta, trail mix, peanut butter pretzels, and turkey jerky. After about ten minutes they were able to scare the bear away by yelling.

BlameFactorDesc: Improper storage of a bear attractant
IncidentDescription: Backpack was found in the river on the edge water near site #504 North Pines. It was ripped up, there was chapstick in a pouch, unknown if any other food items were once inside. Was given to Wildlife by campground ranger, then given to lost and found because it contained an ID.
Backpack found up in the boulders above Camp 4. Scented items torn apart plus food wrappers.
Backpack found up in the boulders above Camp 4. Scented items torn apart plus food wrappers.
Juvenile left a half sandwich in his backpack and then left the pack on the picnic table. The visitor woke up at 4:30 and heard a bear ripping the pack. The backpack was destroyed.
Juvenile left a half sandwich in his backpack and then left the pack on the picnic table. The visitor woke up at 4:30 and heard a bear ripping the pack. The backpack was destroyed.

Bear was seen getting in to a bear locker. Bear obtained a bag of marshmallows. The bear was large, possibly 3520. The bear was yelled at and chased off. The bear went about fifty feet in to the woods and people threw pine cones and the bear walked away.

Visitors were honking horns and banging pots. The bear approached the picnic table and opened a large cooler and took a bag of lunch meat. He left and returned three times without coming closer than 75 to 100 feet before leaving. Bear #3132 confirmed at the location by GPS at that exact time.
R. Leahy found a vehicle that had obvious signs of a break in, and a taped up front left window. Unknown where it occurred because there was no glass present at the scene.

Heard noise about 0400, did not investigate until about 0800. There was some blood mixed with the fur on the drivers door. The bear broke the window, went inside. There was no evidence of food items left inside the car. A few hours later another visitor saw a bear nearby shaking an RV.

The visitor was making breakfast on the patio and the bear came up to his bear box. The bear sniffed the bear box and the visitors stood there looking at it. They left the site to look for help and left their food. The bear ate pistachios, 2 snickers bars, peanut butter, and bread. A camp host came back with the visitors and scared the bear off. They said it was hard to scare it off.

The bear approached picnickers and they backed away. The bear took an insulated bag of food. The victims took photos and left without getting their food back. Bear obtained 2 pancake mixes, hot chocolate packets, some cooking oil, and granola bars. Someone's air horn finally scared the bear.

The bear approached picnickers and they backed away. The bear took an insulated bag of food. The victims took photos and left without getting their food back. Bear obtained 2 pancake mixes, hot chocolate packets, some cooking oil, and granola bars. Someone's air horn finally scared the bear.

Report from dispatch of a bear approaching people. They got in their car and left and called it in from Curry Village. Unknown how much food was obtained as the people were gone. Wildlife staff found the bear but no trash or evidence of the incident. Inferred that the bear did not get much as there was no picnic carnage around.
Seen on a video. 3132 walked within feet of ten people and took a bag from an unoccupied wheelchair and then swam across the river with the bag and walked away.
Passed along by Naturebridge via email showing a photo of bear 3132 in locker eating the contents. Visitor admitted that the locker likely wasn’t fully latched.

Visitors were too far from food at the river. The bear approached through a crowded picnic area while other people struggled to chase the bear off of the food. The bear returned to the picnic area when Wildlife staff arrived.

The Kennel shed door was open and broken. The door was locked but pushed open, and the base of the door appeared to be torn or chewed apart. It is unknown whether there was any food present in the shed. The stables workers said that there was no food in the shed and that the door had been locked for years and they didn't use it.

NPS volunteer said that she was walking on the boardwalk and saw a bear with a collar and a blue tag trying to get apples from the tree that’s right next to the boardwalk. The bear huffed and took three steps forward, bluff charging her. She stepped back and walked away.
Bear 3520 ate a package of ramen from somewhere in the first loop of camp. Wildlife staff hazed the bear away.
Food was left out in a backpack. The bear ripped the pack and ate a couple small food items and granola bars.
Food was left out in a backpack. The bear ripped the pack and ate a couple small food items and granola bars.

Bear obtained one package of muffins and one package of tortillas out of the locker before Wildlife staff arrived and chased him off. The visitors said that they must not have closed the locker properly as they don’t come here often. The bear tried to get in to the cooler but it was latched shut and he did not get in.
Found bear 3520 in camp near site #138. Chased out with bean bag. Neighbors reported bear eating Cheetos in the campsite.

Unestablished picnic area behind Camp 6 parking beside Merced River. Family was 50' away when bear got on picnic table. The bear was ran off by Park Rangers but returned within 100 yards within a few minutes. Wildlife biologist arrived with non-lethal shotgun and chased it away. The bear was acting very brazen, allowing the biologist to get within 30 yards before retreating after getting fired at. The bear eventually climbed up a cedar tree.

Visitors woke up early this morning to sounds coming from their cargo trailer. Said a bear had broken the cotter pin and opened the hatch of the trailer and obtained at least 3 bags of marshmallows and loaf of garlic bread. Group yelled and threw small objects, bear returned to the trailer then walked away. They said they only for sure saw one bear at the trailer, and it had a collar and ear tag, but saw 2 bears, one considerably larger than the other walking away from their campsite. Bear paw prints left on the trailer that we inspected suggest it was a smaller bear.

We came upon 3520 in locker, he ran away when chased. There were many small items chewed on or ripped. Bars and snacks only. Some toiletries chewed on. White 5 was also very close and was hazed out soon after.

The bear popped the rear window hatch open without damaging the vehicle. Bear ate trash out of two backpacks which were damaged. Packs contained chapstick, wrappers and Ziploc bags with trail mix remains. The bear would not come out of the vehicle for over 20 minutes, huffing at us when we tried to scare him out. Opened the back passenger door for the bear to exit from. Finally was able to paintball the bear through a passenger window that was left down a few inches which encouraged the bear to leave the vehicle. Bear ran towards Curry.
Bear damaged back pack. Bear obtained minimal food items including: Gatorade, corn nuts, energy bar.
Bear damaged back pack. Bear obtained minimal food items including: Gatorade, corn nuts, energy bar.

While moving food items from the bear box to their vehicle, the bear came into the campsite and stole food items from the bear box. The bear was subsequently ran off by campers. Described as "miscellaneous food:. The desk officer is new and did not ask the people exactly what food was taken. *visitor to far
Locker improperly latched. Bear obtained chips, most of them spilled on the ground as we chased him into the woods.

LocationDetail: JMT at Sunrise Creek and Cloud's Rest jnct.
IncidentDescription: The bear obtained the food hang and the visitors attempted to scare the bear off within 10 ft. The bear then bluff charged within 3-4 ft. and the visitors deployed bear spray at the bear. Bravo 41 (Wayne) reported this incident via phone. The visitors were cited for improper food storage.

BlameFactorDesc: Improper storage of a bear attractant
IncidentDescription: Visitor woke up to canisters being beaten around at the campsite around 1:30am. He started yelling and the movement stopped. Nine minutes later he heard it again and turned on a flashlight. He saw a bear with his backpack in its mouth. He ran after the bear yelling and the bear dropped the pack. Minor damage to the pack, teeth marks and small rips. The visitor thinks that the odor of gel food wrapper in the pocket attracted the bear. He said he noticed a collar but couldn't swear by it. GPS shows 2311 in that area but not confirmed as her.

The food was secured in a U-Haul trailer. The bear ripped the door off the back. The door will have to be replaced but the rest of the trailer is ok. The only confirmed item taken from the trailer was a box of cereal. After that the bear was scared off.

The food was secured in a U-Haul trailer. The bear ripped the door off the back. The door will have to be replaced but the rest of the trailer is ok. The only confirmed item taken from the trailer was a box of cereal. After that the bear was scared off.

Second hand report of a bear taking a pack at the Half Dome junction on the JMT. The pack went missing while people were hiking half dome. Visitor noticed a stash of food items while looking for the missing pack including sunblock, wrappers, and Starbucks instant coffee packets.

Second hand report of a bear taking a pack at the Half Dome junction on the JMT. The pack went missing while people were hiking half dome. Visitor noticed a stash of food items while looking for the missing pack including sunblock, wrappers, and Starbucks instant coffee packets.

Hikers showed a picture to 875 L. West of Yellow 50 tearing through a large pack at the junction. The RP said that the owners of the pack were not there and likely hiking half dome. The RP wasn't sure if food was obtained or not but the damage to the pack seemed significant. No one tried to chase the bear off, just took pictures. 875 was unable to locate the owners of the pack.
Visitors reported to a Wilderness ranger that they walked up on a bear eating a Mountain House meal package. The bear ran away and no other details were given.

The bear ripped off the siding of a shed. Bear tore a hole in one building to get to feed bags that had minimal residual grain in them. The bags were not damaged, just slobbered on. The second building borders Lamon's Orchard. The bear tore the siding off a building to gain access to a metal storage shed that was secure. The bear ate the rubber door seal but did not gain access to food. Metal storage shed held bags of oats.

LocationDetail: Le Conte Boulder next to Le Conte Memorial
IncidentDescription: The bear approached climbers who were bouldering, they tried to scare it off unsuccessfully. The bear pawed at the ground and they backed up. The bear went up to their climbing gear and took a climbing shoe and ran off. Second hand report from DNC interp.

The visitors believed they saw a grizzly and backed away from their canister. The bear grabbed it in her mouth and ran at least a quarter mile with it before Bravo 41 caught up to her and hit her with a slug and recovered the remaining contents of the canister.
According to LYV 12 the campers left their lunch for the next day out and the bear grabbed the bag and ran away.

Wildlife staff went through the LYV campsites talking to people about food storage at night. In the morning Victor 29 said that a visitor's canister was taken about 50 yards away from camp by a bear and that almost all the contents were gone. The visitor told Victor 29 that the bear ranger had told him about food storage and to maybe put his canister in the locker if there was space. The visitor was cited for not latching all the pins of the canister. The lid was bent back at the one pin that was not latched. The lid was easily bent back into place. It was their first day on the JMT.

Traditional Native American Walk camp. Hannah Hedstrom from Wilderness camped with them and reported that they had no food storage equipment. There were coolers and boxes of food covered with a tarp and trash bags tied to trees. The bear visited between 1am to 3am. She was able to scare the bear away easily. The bear came back later when everyone was asleep and got garbage and one backpack that was not recovered.

Traditional Native American Walk camp. Hannah Hedstrom from Wilderness camped with them and reported that they had no food storage equipment. There were coolers and boxes of food covered with a tarp and trash bags tied to trees. The bear visited between 1am to 3am. She was able to scare the bear away easily. The bear came back later when everyone was asleep and got garbage and one backpack that was not recovered.

Second hand report from other campers that a group of a mother and 2 sons lost 3 canisters. They were warned by the reporting campers about the bear in the area and not camping too close to the cliffs. In the morning the canisters were missing.

Second hand report from other campers that a group of a mother and 2 sons lost 3 canisters. They were warned by the reporting campers about the bear in the area and not camping too close to the cliffs. In the morning the canisters were missing.
Call came in on bear hotline. The bear took a pack that had food in it. The bear came back multiple times after it was scared off. No other info given.
Call came in on bear hotline. The bear took a pack that had food in it. The bear came back multiple times after it was scared off. No other info given.

LocationDetail: 2 miles East of Tamarack Flat CG
IncidentDescription: L. West came upon a bear jam on the side of the road and tried to clear it. He witnessed a visitor throw food towards the bear. He ran towards them but the sped away and Logan called it in to dispatch. He parked the truck and grabbed the paintball gun and chased the bear away. Unclear whether the bear got the food or not as Logan was unable to find it. Mike 53 tried to find the car but was unsuccessful.

Party of 15 people carried only 5 bear canisters. Bear obtained a significant food reward. They left food in a pack and the bear destroyed it. The bear also pushed a canister over the cliff to obtain food. The ranger at the Wilderness Center warned them about travelling in that large of a group and how many canisters to take. They also hung food garbage from a tree.

Party of 15 people carried only 5 bear canisters. Bear obtained a significant food reward. They left food in a pack and the bear destroyed it. The bear also pushed a canister over the cliff to obtain food. The ranger at the Wilderness Center warned them about travelling in that large of a group and how many canisters to take. They also hung food garbage from a tree.

Party of 15 people carried only 5 bear canisters. Bear obtained a significant food reward. They left food in a pack and the bear destroyed it. The bear also pushed a canister over the cliff to obtain food. The ranger at the Wilderness Center warned them about travelling in that large of a group and how many canisters to take. They also hung food garbage from a tree.

A small amount of trail mix was left with camera gear (Canon 3TI) in a black Nike drawstring bag and was overlooked when checking bags for food. The visitors hear the bear bang around their canisters and woke up to their camera being gone. It was later recovered undamaged. They were cited by Bravo 41.

The bear came up while they were making dinner, the visitors stepped away and the bear took the canister with the lid off. Then at 2:30am the bear took a backpack and tore the pocket that had an empty beef jerky wrapper in it. The pack was recovered. The bear ate oatmeal and "dinner." Canister not recovered.

The bear came up while they were making dinner, the visitors stepped away and the bear took the canister with the lid off. Then at 2:30am the bear took a backpack and tore the pocket that had an empty beef jerky wrapper in it. The pack was recovered. The bear ate oatmeal and "dinner." Canister not recovered.

Visitors were out on a day hike and returned to see that their bear canisters had been rolled around, the stove bag was shredded, and their tent had been walked on. There were paw prints on the top and sides and the poles were bent. No food was out. The paw print size looked to them like a small adult bear.

Visitors were out on a day hike and returned to see that their bear canisters had been rolled around, the stove bag was shredded, and their tent had been walked on. There were paw prints on the top and sides and the poles were bent. No food was out. The paw print size looked to them like a small adult bear.
Visitors had their backs turned and a bear came and took two packs of ramen noodles. The bear returned later but was chased off.

Jen was inside when she noticed a bear on her deck. She saw the bear tear the window screen slightly and leave a nose print on her window. The phots of the bear look like a medium brown, untagged subadult with a gray patch on the shoulder.

The group was camped 10 minutes north of the footbridge, well out of the closed area. They heard the bear between 12 and 2am. They did not get up to scare it away. Two rental Garcia canisters were rolled away from camp. One of the 2 canisters was never found. They looked for the canister #1741 from 6am to 8am but were unable to find it.

Visitor was camped at Snow Creek by the footbridge. They hid the bear canisters (2: 1 rented and 1 personal container) 100 ft away. When they woke up, both canisters were gone. They went down the river and found the rental canister with the top off and some food gone. They never found their personal container. Bear obtained tortillas, cheese, sausage, pasta and toiletries from the canister that popped open.

Visitor was camped at Snow Creek by the footbridge. They hid the bear canisters (2: 1 rented and 1 personal container) 100 ft away. When they woke up, both canisters were gone. They went down the river and found the rental canister with the top off and some food gone. They never found their personal container. Bear obtained tortillas, cheese, sausage, pasta and toiletries from the canister that popped open.

A small light brown bear came into camp and lurched at campers. Campers were eating; the bear came within a few feet of people. The bear ripped up the campers' packs. The encounter lasted 2 minutes. The bear dragged the pack 100 ft before inspecting it. There was no food in the bag. The visitors yelled to scare it away. The bear ripped the pack. By hearsay, a bear got food from other campers too. The next day, and untagged (?) larger golden brown bear explored the camp perimeter. No aggression as it passed by the same camp.

RMS employees returned to Lake Vernon Ranger Station to find their backpacking gear strewn about. A Thermarest was chomped and numerous other gear items were bitten and moved. No food was taken. Canisters were untouched.

The bear quickly batted the rented Garcia bear can away and down the mountain within a minute or two of the visitors scaring it away. The canister was within 10 yards of the tent. They tried scaring it away, but it left quickly as if it was fully knowledgeable of it's tactics. The canister appeared to be in good condition before it went missing.

A large bear was seen in silhouette. The bear was banging on the bear box, then rolled it around. The box did not open, but beer and sugar were probably leaking out. The box was rolled around, and all items inside were covered in food and dirt. The beer can was punctured and leaked. Open sugar box spilled.

LocationDetail: Jct with JMT before sub dome
IncidentDescription: People were leaving packs before climbing sub dome. A bear found a Cliff bar in a hip belt pocket of one of the packs and continued to roam around the area. Visitors reporting were not those whose packs were left or whose property was damaged.

LocationDetail: Jct with JMT before sub dome
IncidentDescription: People were leaving packs before climbing sub dome. A bear found a Cliff bar in a hip belt pocket of one of the packs and continued to roam around the area. Visitors reporting were not those whose packs were left or whose property was damaged.

LocationDetail: Sunrise Creek Jct with Cloud's Rest
IncidentDescription: The bear was aggressive and after bear spray was used it continued to circle the camp. When the visitors woke up, the bear was swatting the food hang in the tree. It fell and was ripped open. The bear didn't get away with much (some pasta) and they scared it off. It scared them when they used bear spray.

LocationDetail: Sunrise Creek Jct with Cloud's Rest
IncidentDescription: The bear was aggressive and after bear spray was used it continued to circle the camp. When the visitors woke up, the bear was swatting the food hang in the tree. It fell and was ripped open. The bear didn't get away with much (some pasta) and they scared it off. It scared them when they used bear spray.

It fell and was ripped open. The bear didn't get away with much (some pasta) and they scared it off. It scared them when they used bear spray.

LocationDetail: Cloud's Rest Jct at Sunrise Creek
IncidentDescription: A bear with a purple tag and a cub got a meal. It approached camp and growled which scared the backpackers away.

LocationDetail: Between the foot bridge and the east switchbacks
IncidentDescription: Camped at the top of Snow Creek. Had 3 rental Garcia canisters that were knocked into the stream. Another group reported seeing the bear take off with the canisters before dinner. Two of the canisters vanished. Visitors were camped roughly 100 feet back from the slope. The bear went for the canisters with deodorant and toiletries an other food items.

LocationDetail: Between the foot bridge and the east switchbacks
IncidentDescription: Camped at the top of Snow Creek. Had 3 rental Garcia canisters that were knocked into the stream. Another group reported seeing the bear take off with the canisters before dinner. Two of the canisters vanished. Visitors were camped roughly 100 feet back from the slope. The bear went for the canisters with deodorant and toiletries an other food items.

Two bear canisters were rolled into Snow Creek overnight. Even after taking all precautions. Also the bear chewed on some camping gear like our table cloth and plastic bag probably due to tiny amounts of food residue.

Bear started trying to break into the canister around 10:30 pm. It continued to about 10:45, then the visitor scared it off. The canister was dragged within 40 feet of his tent food was smashed up inside, unedible.
Bear came at the campsite. Tried to eat the Tupperware. Not scared at all. The bear came back during the night to look at the bear canister.

LocationDetail: Cloud's Rest Jct at Sunrise Creek
IncidentDescription: A larger black bear was encountered 3 times overnight. It grabbed the yellow bear keg and slammed it against the rocks. It ran off when yelled at and came within 3 feet of the tent. Campers were experienced and very "bear aware".
Bear pulled the tree apart to get the rental canister and left when visitors yelled at her. Also spoke with another party who lost a canister the same night.
Bear pulled the tree apart to get the rental canister and left when visitors yelled at her. Also spoke with another party who lost a canister the same night.

A visitor reported to a ranger of 2 reports of a bear swatting a visitor's tent in the night two days ago at the LYV Campground. The rain fly was torn. Unclear if the visitor was in the ten. The visitor left before the ranger could get an interview with the reporting party.

The bear walked pas the tent when the visitors were up talking. The bear ran from the bear bell and loud noise and flashes of light. The bear then came back a second time. This was right after it had already stolen the bear canister and was interested in backpacks. The bear canister was placed far from the cliff or creek and was placed on the flattest surface they could find about 12-15 meters from camp. The bear canister could not be found. It looked as though the canister was rolled south to the cliff edge judging by the marks on the ground. Bear was interested in the backpack. The only contents it could have been attracted to would be the cooker.

The bear walked pas the tent when the visitors were up talking. The bear ran from the bear bell and loud noise and flashes of light. The bear then came back a second time. This was right after it had already stolen the bear canister and was interested in backpacks. The bear canister was placed far from the cliff or creek and was placed on the flattest surface they could find about 12-15 meters from camp. The bear canister could not be found. It looked as though the canister was rolled south to the cliff edge judging by the marks on the ground. Bear was interested in the backpack. The only contents it could have been attracted to would be the cooker.
Bear absconded with bear canister. Saw prints and a couple of scrapes. Ken and Wendy had left the day before (bear management volunteers).
Bear absconded with bear canister. Saw prints and a couple of scrapes. Ken and Wendy had left the day before (bear management volunteers).

Visitors were swimming at Lake Vernon. They heard a bear getting into their packs which had lunch inside. They had forgotten to put it in the canister while swimming. The bear when approached dragged the pack through some brush. They threw rocks nearby and yelled. The bear did not leave. Then they approached the bear closer and it left. The believe that the bear ate one and a half clif bars and a bag of beef jerky. One pack was damaged. It was ripped a little but not destroyed. Later that day the ranger is camped at Vernon and a smaller bear went through his camp and the next morning a larger adult bear (brown) went through camp twice.

Visitors were swimming at Lake Vernon. They heard a bear getting into their packs which had lunch inside. They had forgotten to put it in the canister while swimming. The bear when approached dragged the pack through some brush. They threw rocks nearby and yelled. The bear did not leave. Then they approached the bear closer and it left. The believe that the bear ate one and a half clif bars and a bag of beef jerky. One pack was damaged. It was ripped a little but not destroyed. Later that day the ranger is camped at Vernon and a smaller bear went through his camp and the next morning a larger adult bear (brown) went through camp twice.
One person in the party had let very early. Unknown if they left the bear locker open, but likely improperly latched. The bear obtained a half container of peanuts. Bear was hazed off by 874.

Wildlife responded to a bear getting into food at Swinging Bridge. When they arrived, bear 3132 was close by, so they followed the bear into Yellow Pines Campground and waited for the bear to come into camp. The bear came into the campground and sniffed inside a tent with campers present in the campsite. Cam then chased the bear off with yelling and chasing and 3 rubber slugs. Wildlife returned to Swinging Bridge to talk to the victim's and they showed us a video of 3132 getting on picnic tables 5 feet from people. Bear 3132 bluff charged with a swatting behavior when people tried to scare her off of the picnic table and food was obtained.

Sierra 29 called into dispatch that a visitor used bear spray on a squirrel along the trail and 8 other people were caught in the over spray complaining of itchy eyes and difficulty breathing. Likely bear spray used by a group of teenagers.
Campers at snow creek bridge had bear canister taken. Second time in 2 years at the same area. Could not find canister in surrounding area. No evidence of bear. Model of container is Bear Vault 450.
Campers at snow creek bridge had bear canister taken. Second time in 2 years at the same area. Could not find canister in surrounding area. No evidence of bear. Model of container is Bear Vault 450.

Bear canister was stored between two logs and a rock. With clean pots tied together on top and two trekking poles leaning diagonally on the sides and rope intertwined between all of this. When the visitors woke up in the morning the canister was gone and no one heard signs of a bear or saw signs the next morning. Canister contained medications, toiletries, dark chocolate granola, peanuts etc. Very full canister. Rented from sports chalet. Email attached.

Bear canister was stored between two logs and a rock. With clean pots tied together on top and two trekking poles leaning diagonally on the sides and rope intertwined between all of this. When the visitors woke up in the morning the canister was gone and no one heard signs of a bear or saw signs the next morning. Canister contained medications, toiletries, dark chocolate granola, peanuts etc. Very full canister. Rented from sports chalet. Email attached.

2 bear cans in camp, one was closed the other was open. Hikers were cooking soup. Bear walked up behind a log and stood up on its hind legs to peer at the hikers cooking soup. Hikers yelled and stood up and grabbed poles to bang together. Hikers became scared and thought the bear was becoming aggressive so they backed away from their open canister. Bear approached canister, grabbed it by its opening, and walked away. Canister was unrecovered. Bear obtained trail mix, bars, and medications from a first aid kit.

2 bear cans in camp, one was closed the other was open. Hikers were cooking soup. Bear walked up behind a log and stood up on its hind legs to peer at the hikers cooking soup. Hikers yelled and stood up and grabbed poles to bang together. Hikers became scared and thought the bear was becoming aggressive so they backed away from their open canister. Bear approached canister, grabbed it by its opening, and walked away. Canister was unrecovered. Bear obtained trail mix, bars, and medications from a first aid kit.

2 bear cans in camp, one was closed the other was open. Hikers were cooking soup. Bear walked up behind a log and stood up on its hind legs to peer at the hikers cooking soup. Hikers yelled and stood up and grabbed poles to bang together. Hikers became scared and thought the bear was becoming aggressive so they backed away from their open canister. Bear approached canister, grabbed it by its opening, and walked away. Canister was unrecovered. Bear obtained trail mix, bars, and medications from a first aid kit.

I had my can about 20 feet from my tent with a cup on top as an alarm. I awoke immediately and began hazing the bear. It didn't respond besides to look up occasionally. She bluff charged me once. I began throwing stones and pine cones in its direction and she began to move away, but she rolled/carried the can with her. With a tree line between myself and her it was hard to see exactly where she was but I continued to haze her the whole time. Then she gave up and ran off. I wasn't sure if she juggled the can further so I spent 20 minutes walking the knee to waist high grasses before I found the can. She did not return. She did not obtain any food.

Off duty Camp Towonga employee accidentally left a day pack on the roadside next to a vehicle. Upon return the next day they found the pack destroyed and the contents consumed. Food obtained included: 2 sandwiches, 1 chocolate bar, 1 bag of pretzels, 1 pack of EmergenC, some Advil, 1 pack of animal crackers.

Off duty Camp Towonga employee accidentally left a day pack on the roadside next to a vehicle. Upon return the next day they found the pack destroyed and the contents consumed. Food obtained included: 2 sandwiches, 1 chocolate bar, 1 bag of pretzels, 1 pack of EmergenC, some Advil, 1 pack of animal crackers.

LocationDetail: Sunrise Creek Junction with Cloud's Rest
IncidentDescription: No other details aside from canisters left open and they were damaged.

LocationDetail: Sunrise Creek Junction with Cloud's Rest
IncidentDescription: No other details aside from canisters left open and they were damaged.

LocationDetail: Valley Loop Trail near North Pines
IncidentDescription: Visitors were picnicking near the river on the trail. Food was about 20 feet away with their backs turned. The bear walked straight up to the food. Obtained: mayo packet and zucchini.
Small bear went through Backpacker's Camp and then into North Pines Campground and was digging through camper's stuff at North Pines. Damaged pack.

A visitor reported that a group camping near them had a bear rip into their tent and possibly obtain food from inside. The visitor showed pictures of what appeared to be a black yearling. The visitor reporting this wanted to remain anonymous. Another incident report stated: "A clever bear was aggressive toward the bear canister. Not hostile to humans. The bear was frustrated when it couldn’t open the canister and took its frustration out on the tent." Presumed to be the same incident.

David woke up to being bit in the face by a large bear. Appears the bear was after the air mattress as there was an additional rip in the tent and bite marks that popped the mattress. Bears upper canines lacerated under the left eye about 2'' and the other canine created a significant puncture on the cheek but did not go all the way through the mouth.

David woke up to being bit in the face by a large bear. Appears the bear was after the air mattress as there was an additional rip in the tent and bite marks that popped the mattress. Bears upper canines lacerated under the left eye about 2'' and the other canine created a significant puncture on the cheek but did not go all the way through the mouth.
Brown colored bear w/ 2 tags charged and pursued hiker to within 15 feet and stood on its hind legs and clacked its teeth and huffed. Possible orange tag but individual was color blind so unsure.

Dakota chased bear off from backpacker's, plastic Ziploc in its mouth. Unknown what food was inside. Visitors claimed they had come back from their hike and forgot or didn't know what happened. They were at the creek.

LocationDetail: JMT and Half Dome trail junction
IncidentDescription: Two of three backpacks that were stashed at the junction were damaged by the bear. Bear cans were stashed. Rory (victor unit) saw cub batting canisters around. Sleeping bag pulled out and sleeping pad both had damage. No food/ scented items found in packs. All food seemingly stored properly.

LocationDetail: JMT and Half Dome trail junction
IncidentDescription: Two of three backpacks that were stashed at the junction were damaged by the bear. Bear cans were stashed. Rory (victor unit) saw cub batting canisters around. Sleeping bag pulled out and sleeping pad both had damage. No food/ scented items found in packs. All food seemingly stored properly.

Sleeping bag pulled out and sleeping pad both had damage. No food/ scented items found in packs. All food seemingly stored properly.

LYV Ranger told hikers that it would be ok to store packs devoid of food and scents at the JMT Half Dome Junction. They stored their packs there and returned to find them ripped into and a majority of their new backpacking gear had puncture marks and was un-usable. Visitors were very upset about the misleading information.

LocationDetail: Half Dome trail and JMT junction
IncidentDescription: Per Wayne: found a food bag that was torn into ~5000 calorie food reward.

Visitor backcountry report. Saw bear on trail, had no interest in us, kept walking away from our campsite. Upon return to our site we noticed the top of one pack was torn open. The brain of pack was ripped.
Per Wayne: a group of boy scouts left a lid off a canister and at 2-3 am, P6 got Gatorade mix out of it.
Bear bin left open, Gatorade eaten 100 feet away.
Per Wayne Hartlerode: bear went through LYV campground and took a pack with tuna left in it. Pack recovered.

Naturebridge instructor returned with students to LYV campsite at 21:30 to find a bear near their campsite eating some food from a bag. The educator realized it was her bag and that her whole backpack was also missing. They searched and found the backpack devoid of its food contents. Sunscreen and camelback were also ripped open. There was a small tear in the backpack. The Naturebridge folks scared the bear away with clanging pots.

Naturebridge instructor returned with students to LYV campsite at 21:30 to find a bear near their campsite eating some food from a bag. The educator realized it was her bag and that her whole backpack was also missing. They searched and found the backpack devoid of its food contents. Sunscreen and camelback were also ripped open. There was a small tear in the backpack. The Naturebridge folks scared the bear away with clanging pots.

There was a small tear in the backpack. The Naturebridge folks scared the bear away with clanging pots.
Rummaging around campsite looking for food. Took a bite out of pocket, found nothing. Moved on to some other tent site. Chased bear out of campsite across sunset creek and about 100 yards farther.

BlameFactorDesc: Improper storage of a bear attractant
IncidentDescription: RMS Invasives crew camped at Harden Lake… off working for the day at another site. Reportedly walking back to camp and saw bear digging into a bees nest. Turns out it actually had Justin Rice's backpack which had essential oils in it. Backpack damaged. Took >7 people to scare the bear off. Noticed tent was also damaged. Sleeping bag & pad. Tobacco stored in tent, damaged.

Bear tore into RMS invasive crew members pack day before. Next morning the bear came into camp and tore up plastic Tupperware. Bear likely got food garbage from Ricky's pack that day. Bear extremely difficult to chase off. Garrett Dickman is the supervisor.

Bear cans were hidden away from camp under brush, bear obtained two bear cans and threw off of gully, was only able to gain access to bear can containing trash. Ate remnants of PB and backpacker's dinner. Trash Recovered, lid to bear can lost.

Bear cans were hidden away from camp under brush, bear obtained two bear cans and threw off of gully, was only able to gain access to bear can containing trash. Ate remnants of PB and backpacker's dinner. Trash Recovered, lid to bear can lost.
Heard bear run away. A dark chocolate wrapper was left in a backpack at a campsite that did not have bear boxes. The bear got dark chocolate remnants and tore into a pack.
Heard bear run away. A dark chocolate wrapper was left in a backpack at a campsite that did not have bear boxes. The bear got dark chocolate remnants and tore into a pack.

LocationDetail: 200 yards south of snow creek footbridge campsite
IncidentDescription: "2 bear canisters near fire pit by log in sand. Both were missing in morning. No evidence of bear. Tracks or drag marks (circles in sand) were in tact and only boot prints. Pre-packaged food and toiletries in canisters in Ziploc bags and plastic bag provided. Canisters were closed and locked."

Pre-packaged food and toiletries in canisters in Ziploc bags and plastic bag provided. Canisters were closed and locked."
